sentences.sContent: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.
sentences.sCn: 人们已经变得对别人的痛苦漠不关心。

sentences.sContent: ...psychologist Debra Gold of the Duke Center for the study of aging and human development found that about 20% said they were hostile or indifferent to ward their sisters and brothers...
...people become more and more indifferent to each other in real life...
...Turtles are by nature indifferent to human activities...
...But Nature is indifferent to human notions of fairness...
...What does the author mean by “Nature is indifferent to human notions of fairness”...

synos.tran: 漠不关心的；无关紧要的；中性的，中立的

trans.tranOther: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it
